intro: Cyrtanthus capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Cyrtanthus capensis produces sword-shaped leaves and has a bulbous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
